page.title: 12Clubs and Societies, Buckden
page.content: When the village expanded around the 1700's, the need grew for a building in which societies could hold their meetings. A group called the Village Hall Trust bought eleven acres of land and built the village hall. Part of the ground is covered by bowling and tennis greens while the main grass area has cricket and football pitches. Many of the village's 35 clubs meet in the hall, from a playgroup to a theatre society. 185 children attend cubs, scouts brownies and guides in their own hut not far away. At school 15 clubs covering a wide range of interests from needlework to football run during lunch times and after school. On Sunday mornings the two churches run Sunday Schools for children aged five to fourteen. It can be seen that the village is a very lively community.
